pageTitle: Public events for December 4, 2015 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
UPDATED

Public events for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Friday, December 4, 2015:

Ottawa

12:00 – 4:00 p.m. – Members of the public invited to the Sir John A. Macdonald Building for a televised viewing of the Speech from the Throne procession and ceremony that will begin at 2:30 p.m. (OPEN TO MEDIA)

Sir John A. Macdonald Building
144 Wellington Street
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for members of the public:

  • Visitors will need to bring photo identification.
  • No outside food or beverages will be allowed on-site. Water will be provided.
  • Only one (1) bag will be permitted per visitor, with a maximum size of: 35.5 cm x 30.5 cm x 19 cm (14 in x 12 in x 7.5 in).
  • Visitors carrying any item that exceeds these dimensions will be denied entry.
  • Loose items stowed in wheelchairs or strollers are not permitted.

Ottawa

12:00 p.m. - The Prime Minister holds a Cabinet meeting.

Centre Block
Parliament Hill
Ottawa, Ontario

Note for media:

  • Media should arrive no later than 1:15 p.m.
  • Media should contact the Parliamentary Press Gallery for accreditation.

Ottawa

2:30 p.m. – The Prime Minister participates in the Speech from the Throne procession and ceremony to officially open the first session of the 42nd Parliament and to outline the Government of Canada’s agenda.

Senate of Canada
Centre Block
Parliament Hill
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Media should contact the Parliamentary Press Gallery for accreditation.
  • Open to pool media.

Additional Notes:

  • The Speech from the Throne will be broadcast live on television and online at http://parlvu.parl.gc.ca.
  • Additional information about the Speech from the Throne can be found online at www.canada.ca/thronespeech.

PMO Media Relations: 613-957-5555
